title: Do things fall to the ground because earth curves time around it? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Do things fall to the ground because earth curves time around it?” First a disclaimer: I am not a physicist, so there may be flaws in this explanation. Einstein’s general theory of relativity says that four-dimensional space-time (note, not just time) is curved by the presence of massive objects such as the Earth, and this causes masses to be attracted to each other. As I understand it, this is the cause of gravity. But as a chemical engineer, I’ve never come across a situation where relativistic effects have been significant, so I always stick to Newtonian mechanics and gravity, because it works for me.
